spatialpy.BoundaryCondition module¶

SpatialPy is a Python 3 package for simulation of spatial deterministic/stochastic reaction-diffusion-advection problems Copyright (C) 2021 SpatialPy developers.

This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE Version 3 as published by the Free Software Foundation.

This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE Version 3 for more details.

You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program. If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.

class spatialpy.BoundaryCondition.BoundaryCondition(xmin=None, xmax=None, ymin=None, ymax=None, zmin=None, zmax=None, type_id=None, species=None, deterministic=True, property=None, value=None, model=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Set spatial regions of the domain where a property of particles are held constant (updated each simulation step)

Conditions (one or more of the following must be set):

  • xmin, xmax: (float) min or max value in the x dimension

  • ymin, ymax: (float) min or max value in the y dimension

  • zmin, zmax: (float) min or max value in the z dimension

  • type_id: type (subdomain) of the partciles

Targets (one of the following must be set):

property: (str), ‘nu’, ‘rho’,’v’ species: (str) name of a chemical species.

Must also set deterministic=True/False flag.

Parameters

  • xmin (float) – x-axis coordinate lower bound of condition

  • xmax (float) – x-axis coordinate upper bound of condition

  • ymin (float) – y-axis coordinate lower bound of condition

  • ymax (float) – y-axis coordinate upper bound of condition

  • zmin (float) – z-axis coordinate lower bound of condition

  • zmax (float) – z-axis coordinate upper bound of condition

  • typeid (int) – Set condition to particle type id

  • species (str) – Set target of boundary condition to target Species. If set, determinstic must also be set to True/False.

  • deterministic (bool) – Must be set if target is Species. Set True if boundary condition target is species and applies to deterministic simulation. BoundaryCondition not yet implemeneted for Stochastic Species.

  • property (str) – Set target to properties, can be ‘nu’ ‘rho’ or ‘v’

  • value (float or float[3]) – Value property will take in region defined by the conditions

  • model (spatialpy.Model.Model) – Target model of boundary condition

expression()[source]¶

Creates evaluable string expression of boundary condition.

Return type

str

classmethod create_2D_domain(xlim, ylim, nx, ny, type_id=1, mass=1.0, nu=1.0, fixed=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Create a filled 2D domain :param xlim: (tuple) highest and lowest coordinate in the x dimension :param ylim: (tuple) highest and lowest coordinate in the y dimension :param nx: (int) number of particle spacing in the x dimension :param ny: (int) number of particle spacing in the y dimension :param type_id: (int, default: 1) default type ID of particles created to be created :param mass: (float, default: 1.0) default mass of particles created to be created :param nu: (float, default: 1.0) default viscosity of particles created to be created :param fixed: (bool, default: false) spatially fixed flag of particles created to be created :param rho0: (float, default: 1.0) background density for the system :param c0: (float, default: 10) speed of sound for the system :param P0: (float, default: 10) background pressure for the system

Returns

Domain object

classmethod create_3D_domain(xlim, ylim, zlim, nx, ny, nz, type_id=1, mass=1.0, nu=1.0, fixed=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Create a filled 3D domain :param xlim: (tuple) highest and lowest coordinate in the x dimension :param ylim: (tuple) highest and lowest coordinate in the y dimension :param zlim: (tuple) highest and lowest coordinate in the z dimension :param nx: (int) number of particle spacing in the x dimension :param ny: (int) number of particle spacing in the y dimension :param nz: (int) number of particle spacing in the z dimension :param type_id: (int, default: 1) default type ID of particles created to be created :param mass: (float, default: 1.0) default mass of particles created to be created :param nu: (float, default: 1.0) default viscosity of particles created to be created :param fixed: (bool, default: false) spatially fixed flag of particles created to be created :param rho0: (float, default: 1.0) background density for the system :param c0: (float, default: 10) speed of sound for the system :param P0: (float, default: 10) background pressure for the system

Returns

Domain object

class spatialpy.InitialCondition.InitialCondition[source]¶

Bases: object

Class used to defined initial conditions in SpatialPy. SubClasses must implement the ‘apply(model)’ method, which direction modifies the model.u0[species,voxel] matrix.

class spatialpy.Model.Model(name='')[source]¶

Bases: object

Representation of a spatial biochemical model.

add_boundary_condition(bc)[source]¶

Add an BoundaryCondition object to the model.

add_data_function(data_function)[source]¶

Add a scalar spatial function to the simulation. This is useful if you have a spatially varying in put to your model. Argument is a instances of subclass of the spatialpy.DataFunction class. It must implement a function ‘map(x)’ which takes a the spatial positon ‘x’ as an array, and it returns a float value.

add_domain(domain)[source]¶

Add a domain to the model

domainDomain

The Domain object to be added to the model

add_initial_condition(ic)[source]¶

Add an initial condition object to the initialization of the model.

add_parameter(params)[source]¶

Add Parameter(s) to model.listOfParameters. Input can be either a single Parameter object or a list of Parameter objects.

add_reaction(reacs)[source]¶

Add Reaction(s) to the model. Input can be single instance, a list of instances or a dict with name, instance pairs.

add_species(obj)[source]¶

Adds a species, or list of species to the model.

obj¶

The species or list of species to be added to the model object.

Type

Species, or list of Species

reserved_names = ['vol']¶
resolve_parameters()[source]¶

Attempt to resolve all parameter expressions to scalar floating point values. Must be called prior to exporting the model.

restrict(species, listOfTypes)[source]¶
Set the diffusion coefficient to zero for ‘species’ in all types not in

‘listOfTypes’. This effectively restricts the movement of ‘species’ to the types specified in ‘listOfTypes’.

Parameters

  • species – an instance of a ‘spatialpy.Species’.

  • listOfTypes – a list, each object in the list should be a ‘type_id’

run(number_of_trajectories=1, seed=None, timeout=None, number_of_threads=None, debug_level=0, debug=False, profile=False)[source]¶

Simulate the model. :param number_of_trajectories: How many trajectories should be run. :param seed: (int) The random seed given to the solver. :param number_of_threads: (int) The number threads the solver will use. :param debug_level: (int) Level of output from the solver: 0, 1, or 2. Default: 0.

Returns

A SpatialPy.Result object with the results of the simulation.

set_parameter(pname, expression)[source]¶

Set the expression of an existing paramter.

set_timesteps(step_size, num_steps)[source]¶

” Set the simlation time span parameters :param step_size: float, size of each timestep in seconds :param num_steps: int, total number of steps to take

Note: the number of output times will be num_steps+1 as the first

output will be at time zero.

set_type(geometry_ivar, type_id, mass=None, nu=None, fixed=False)[source]¶

Add a type definition to the model. By default, all regions are set to type 0. :param geometry_ivar: an instance of a ‘spatialpy.Geometry’ subclass. The ‘inside()’ method

of this object will be used to assign type_id to points.

Parameters

  • type_id – (usually an int) the identifier for this type

  • mass – (float) the mass of each particle in the type

  • nu – (float) the viscosity of each particle in the type

  • fixed – (bool) are the particles in this type immobile

Return values:

Number of domain points that were tagged with this type_id

special_characters = ['[', ']', '+', '-', '*', '/', '.', '^']¶
timespan(time_span, timestep_size=None)[source]¶

Set the time span of simulation. The SSA-SDPD engine does not support non-uniform timespans.

tspannumpy ndarray

Evenly-spaced list of times at which to sample the species populations during the simulation.

update_namespace()[source]¶

Create a dict with flattened parameter and species objects.

Bases: Exception

class spatialpy.Model.Parameter(name='', expression=None, value=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Model of a rate paramter. A parameter can be given as a String expression (function) or directly as a scalar value. If given a String expression, it should be evaluable in the namespace of a parent Model.

evaluate(namespace={})[source]¶

Evaluate the expression and return the (scalar) value

set_expression(expression)[source]¶
exception spatialpy.Model.ParameterError[source]¶

Bases: spatialpy.Model.ModelError

class spatialpy.Model.Reaction(name='', reactants={}, products={}, propensity_function=None, massaction=None, rate=None, annotation=None, restrict_to=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Models a biochemical reaction. A reaction conatains dictinaries of species (reactants and products) and parameters. The reaction’s propensity function needs to be evaluable and result in a non-negative scalar value in the namespace defined by the union of its Reactant, Product and Parameter dictionaries.

class spatialpy.Result.Result(model=None, result_dir=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Result object for a URDME simulation.

export_to_csv(folder_name=None)[source]¶
Write the trajectory to a set of CSV files. The first, modelname_mesh.csv, specifies the mesh.

The other files, modelname_species_S.csv, for species named S, specify trajectory data for each species. The columns of modelname_mesh.csv are: ‘Voxel ID’, ‘X’, ‘Y’, ‘Z’, ‘Type’, ‘Volume’, ‘Mass’, ‘Viscosity’ The columns of modelname_species_S.csv: ‘Time’, ‘Voxel 0’, Voxel 1’, … ‘Voxel N’.

folder_name¶

A path where the vtk files will be written, created if non-existant. If no path is provided current working directory is used.

Type

str (default current working directory)

export_to_vtk(timespan, folder_name=None)[source]¶

Write the trajectory to a collection of vtk files. The exported data is #molecules/volume, where the volume unit is implicit from the mesh dimension.

get_property(property_name, timepoints=None)[source]¶

Get the property values for a given species in the model for one or all timepoints.

If ‘timepoints’ is None (default), a matrix of dimension: (number of timepoints) x (number of voxels) is returned. If an integer value is given, that value is used to index into the timespan, and that time point is returned as a 1D array with size (number of voxel).

get_species(species, timepoints=None, concentration=False, deterministic=False, debug=False)[source]¶
Get the populations/concentration values for a given species in the model for

one or all timepoints.

species¶

A species in string or dictionary form to retreive information about

Type

str/dict

timepoints¶

A time point where the information should be retreived from. If ‘timepoints’ is None (default), a matrix of dimension: (number of timepoints) x (number of voxels) is returned. If an integer value is given, that value is used to index into the timespan, and that time point is returned as a 1D array with size (number of voxel).

Type

int (default None)

concentration¶

Whether or not the species is a concentration (True) or population (False) If concentration is False (default), the integer, raw, trajectory data is returned. If set to True, the concentration (=copy_number/volume) is returned.

Type

bool (default False)

deterministic¶

Whether or not the species is deterministic (True) or stochastic (False)

Type

bool (default False)

debug¶

Whether or not debug information should be printed

Type

bool (default False)

Returns

A numpy array containing the species population/concentration values

Return type

numpy.ndarray

get_timespan()[source]¶

Get the model time span.

Returns

A numpy array containing the time span of the model

Return type

numpy.ndarray

plot_species(species, t_ndx=0, concentration=False, deterministic=False, width=None, height=None, colormap=None, size=5, title=None, animated=False, t_ndx_list=None, speed=1, f_duration=500, t_duration=300, return_plotly_figure=False, use_matplotlib=False, debug=False)[source]¶

Plots the Results using plotly. Can only be viewed in a Jupyter Notebook.

If concentration is False (default), the integer, raw, trajectory data is returned, if set to True, the concentration (=copy_number/volume) is returned.

If deterministic is True, show results for determinstic (instead of stochastic) values

Type

Type

int

concentration¶

Whether or not to plot the data as stochastic concentration, ignored if deterministic is set to True

class spatialpy.Solver.Solver(model, debug_level=0)[source]¶

Bases: object

SpatialPy solver object.

compile(debug=False, profile=False)[source]¶

Compile the model.

create_propensity_file(file_name=None)[source]¶

Generate the C propensity file that is used to compile the solvers.

read_profile_info(result)[source]¶
run(number_of_trajectories=1, seed=None, timeout=None, number_of_threads=None, debug=False, profile=False, verbose=True)[source]¶

Run one simulation of the model. :param number_of_trajectories: (int) How many trajectories should be simulated. :param seed: (int) the random number seed (incremented by one for multiple runs). :param timeout: (int) maximum number of seconds the solver can run. :param number_of_threads: (int) the number threads the solver will use. :param debug: (bool) start a gdbgui debugger (also compiles with debug symbols

if compilation hasn’t happened)

Parameters

profile – (bool) output gprof profiling data if available

Returns

Result object.

or, if number_of_trajectories > 1

a list of Result objects

run_debugger()[source]¶

Start a gdbgui debugger at port 5000.

spatialpy.Solver.read_from_stdout(stdout, verbose=True)[source]¶

Used with subprocess.Popen and threading to capture all output and print to the screen notebook without waiting or storing the output ina buffer.
